channel.title: Make the tutorial section on moparisthebest.com require moderation?
channel.description:
I'll quote this from where I originally posted it: [quote="lothy, post:170, topic:50802"]I think that the tutorials forum should be made so that every new topic requires moderation before appearing. That would clean that slop of shit up good and proper.[/quote]
So basically, as everyone here would know, a lot of sections on moparisthebest.com are filled with spam. In particular the tutorial forum. It comes down to two things: 1) People are not reading the rules they agree to (and god help them if they don't read a contract's fine print before they sign it when they're adults) OR 2) They think to themselves "Oh, hey a tutorial section. I'll request a tutorial or some help here".
So at the end of the day, it quite simply comes down to people not reading the rules they agree to.
Anyway, I think that the tutorial section should require all *topics* to be moderated. I think that once a topic is given the all clear, it should be free to post on.
If you're an Administrator or Global Mod, then you're probably thinking to yourself "that's going to put a lot of extra pressure on the staff over there". Well, you're probably right. But then again, they wouldn't need to be locking the additional topics. I'd imagine it's just a simple matter of ticking check boxes to approve them, and deleting the remainder (or something along those lines). The only other thing left would be to establish strict guidelines amongst *all* moderators over there; obviously some people are going to think one tutorial is complex, while others will think it's a 10 second job; skill levels vary.
Anyway, I have Mod Taharok's support on this - I'm sure the other staff there also support this.
Now I have a request before you reply to this topic. I've seen a lot of people throw shit at people from Moparscape.org lately when they post here, and I don't see why. This post, and other topics posted here have followed the rules and guidelines for *Moparisthebest.com* (in other words, the rules you read before you can even view the forums). So I'm asking you to be mature with your responses - You can keep the 12yr old school yard insults in the school yard. You may or may not like people over there - if that's the case, then either maintain an unbiased viewpoint, or don't post. It's as simple as that.
Anyway, thanks in advance for the feedback everyone.
Another note to Administrators in particular: Mod Taharok said there was a specific modification just for this - So if you think this is a good idea, you can obtain specifics for this mod from him. :)

item.title: Make the tutorial section on moparisthebest.com require moderation?
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

Javacisnotrecognized:

How about making it read-only then? Those interested in their usefulness can make polls. I doubt having 34 pages of “wt is illgl start of experssino mean?” and “OMG LEECGER :mad:” is useful at current anyway …

Already Suggested, Already Denied.

Read full topic
item.source: Make the tutorial section on moparisthebest.com require moderation?

item.title: Make the tutorial section on moparisthebest.com require moderation?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Mod Taharok, post:25, topic:57574”]The RS2 Server Development/Help section rarely gets spammed. Just because everyone is too lazy to read the FAQs and then post new topics does not mean its spam. Almost every single topic I see in there is relevant to the purpose of the Board itself, thus making it no spam.

I do not think the Tutorials section should be read-only. The future quiz that Moparisthebest wil fully implement should take care of all problems of rule-breakers. Just have a little more patience.[/quote]
Not every rule breaker is an idiot.
Some people do it in pure defiance of rules, be it to spite someone or because they just don’t respect the community.

Read full topic

item.title: Make the tutorial section on moparisthebest.com require moderation?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“therealjdb, post:16, topic:57574”][quote author=lothy link=topic=82006.msg901867#msg901867 date=1171521089]

If this about the moparisthebest.com tutorial section, why not post it over at moparisthebest.com?

This is the ‘General Site Discussion’ section, is it not? Like it or not, this site and www.moparisthebest.com are ‘sister’ sites, so to speak.

This belongs here, and will remain here. The two communities are linked, and at the end of the day can be considered one in the same.

Again, if you’ve got comments that are either off topic, or aiming to inferiorise the people at moparisthebest.com, then keep them to yourself.
[/quote]
Simply put, there is nowhere over there for suggestions.[/quote]
That, and no highly seated members of these forums participate in those forums on a regular enough basis to see any suggestion that could have been posted there.

Read full topic

item.title: Make the tutorial section on moparisthebest.com require moderation?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“nix, post:8, topic:57574”]i quit months ago and came back like a day or 2 ago.

in several months there has been virtually no visable progress from those forums form the says i left. just many more “servers” (testcape sources with different commands which were released ages ago)[/quote]
For the most part, you are right. There are still some people over there making it better, or at least trying to. I’m guessing it will stay that way - there are new people every day, but the number of experienced people never really increases. And then there’s the general attitude from people on this forum towards it. All of these factors delay any real progress.

item.source: Make the tutorial section on moparisthebest.com require moderation?

item.title: Make the tutorial section on moparisthebest.com require moderation?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I back this up one hundred percent. I do not mind the extra work when I log on to also approve new topics. This should not only go to the tutorials section, but to all the MoparScape.org Boards, with the exceptions of a few Boards (RS2 Server Development/Help, MoparScape Questions, Aryan Private Server Scripts, RSC Server Development, and RS Private Server Client Hacking.) However, I found two exploits in this system:

[ul][li]People will constantly rebel against the system. This will result in a lot less registrations and rule-followers.[/li]
[li]People may flame and spam in other sections if they cannot post their tutorial or advertisement in the proper Board.[/li][/ul]

So, to resolve all of this, Moparisthebest will be adding a few more questions to his already-implemented quizical system and soon implement it to all Moparisthebest.com/MoparScape.org. If people to not pass this quiz correctly, they cannot post. This will filter out the peolpe who deserve to stay, and those who do not.

Another thing, I may have said I knew a Modification on it, but I found out the mod I was thinking of would not work in this situation.

Read full topic
item.source: Make the tutorial section on moparisthebest.com require moderation?
